snippet.title: Neymar settles La Liga dispute, signs five-year contract with PSG
snippet.content:
Brazilian international Neymar has signed a five-year contract with Paris Saint-Germain (PSG)﻿ after protracted wrangling over his release clause from La Liga, according to French radio station RMC. Lawyers representing Neymar visited La Liga in Madrid on Thursday to settle the transfer and pay the €222 million ($A330 million) break fee.

Neymar leaving Barca, Spanish superclub confirms
Brazilian striker Neymar has informed Barcelona he plans to leave the club. The soccer superstar is expected to sign with Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) in a world record deal worth nearly $750 million.
Barcelona confirmed in a statement that the player's legal representatives had visited the club and made the payment to terminate his Spanish ties. Barcelona said they would pass on details of the operation to UEFA, European football's governing body, "so that they can determine the disciplinary responsibilities that may arise from this case."
UEFA, whose financial fair play rules ban clubs from spending more than their generated revenue, could not be reached for comment. A source from Spain's La Liga said earlier that the league had rejected the payment of the clause.Photo: AP It was thought La Liga's refusal to accept payment could put the brakes on a transfer that mega-rich PSG believe will help them conquer the Champions League.
